bullets.content: Always include type hints for function parameters and return values using the typing module
Raise TypeError for invalid input types and ValueError for invalid values
Include comprehensive docstrings with Args, Returns, and Raises sections

edge_case_handling.description: Critical edge cases that must be handled

bullets.content: Check for empty collections before accessing elements or performing operations
Handle single-element collections that may not have enough data for the operation
For finding unique values, use set() to eliminate duplicates before processing
Return None or appropriate sentinel value when operation cannot be completed (e.g., finding second largest in single-element list)
Use isinstance() for type checking rather than type() comparison
Validate all elements in a collection using generator expressions with all() or any()
Prefer explicit variable names over abbreviations (e.g., 'unique_numbers' not 'uniq_nums')

common_pitfalls.description: Mistakes to avoid based on past failures

bullets.content: Never assume list indices are valid without checking bounds or catching IndexError
bullets.reflection_summary: Failed case involved accessing items[i] in loop with wrong boundary condition

bullets.content: When sorting is needed, create a sorted copy using sorted() rather than mutating input with .sort()
bullets.reflection_summary: User expected original list to remain unchanged

bullets.content: For numeric operations, explicitly check for the correct numeric type (int, float) before processing
bullets.reflection_summary: Function failed when list contained numeric strings instead of integers

bullets.content: Use set operations for deduplication - O(n) instead of nested loops O(nÂ²)
For finding kth largest/smallest, consider using heapq.nlargest/nsmallest for better performance on large datasets
